definition: to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
awe-inspiring/abbr. for 赫茲|赫兹[he4 zi1], hertz (Hz)
startled/to frighten/scared out of one's skin
lit. killing the chicken to scare the monkey (idiom); to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
(Tw) impressive (from Taiwanese 削削叫, Tai-lo pr. [siah-siah-kiò])
(Tw) impressive (from Taiwanese 削削叫, Tai-lo pr. [siah-siah-kiò])

sentences.english: ELEPHANTS are not fazed by dynamite explosions, but change their behaviour significantly to avoid humans.
sentences.chinese: 大象沒有被甘油炸彈嚇到，反倒是對人的活動很敏感。

sentences.english: We are all interconnected and must live and eat together.
sentences.chinese: 我們之間都是相互聯繫的，在一片天空嚇同吃同住。

sentences.english: The old man brandished his walking stick at the menacing dog.
sentences.chinese: 老人對著那條要咬他的狗揮舞手杖嚇牠走。

sentences.english: Next time when I have to take exams again, I will be not be freaked out.
sentences.chinese: 下次當我參加什麼考試的時候，我再也不會嚇趴下了。

sentences.english: It was time to go out and scare a few people and raid their houses.
sentences.chinese: 看來該是時候出去嚇嚇人，搜刮搜刮他們的房子咯。

sentences.english: Be careful you may frighten someone that you should get to know more intimately if you are too flippant .
sentences.chinese: 如果妳很輕率的話就可能嚇到本來應該親密的人。

sentences.english: Today, I was trying to sneak up my husband while he was playing a computer game.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我準備嚇一下我那在玩電腦的老公。

sentences.english: I'm just calling to introduce myself. My name is Tang.
sentences.chinese: 我打電話是向您作自我嚇，我姓唐。

sentences.english: Just when he decided to take the dish away, he was suddenly startled by his peers.
sentences.chinese: 當他想要把整盤端走的時候，他突然被他的同伴嚇到。

sentences.english: Don't let the title of Kelly's book terrify you.
sentences.chinese: 不要被凱利的著作的名稱嚇到。

sentences.english: Well, maybe they're intimidating the other creatures with their big winkies.
sentences.chinese: 可能他們在水下拿他們的大傢伙嚇其它生物吧。

sentences.english: Frighten, is the person of that sharp monkey sort voice the beneath charge of river Ling gentleman?
sentences.chinese: 嚇，那個尖猴子般聲音的人是江陵君的手下？

sentences.english: I knew enough to be afraid of gasoline.
sentences.chinese: 我十分清楚他們會被汽油嚇到。

sentences.english: He was too strong a man to be bluffed .
sentences.chinese: 他很堅強，不會被虛張聲勢嚇到。

sentences.english: As sparrows eagles, or the hare the lion.
sentences.chinese: 像麻雀嚇蒼鷹，草兔嚇獅子一般。

sentences.english: Eight out of ten men said they would be intimidated by a clever girl.
sentences.chinese: 十個男人裏有八個說他們曾被一個聰明女孩嚇到。

definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
startled/to frighten/scared out of one's skin
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
